alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 3:29PM EDT until May 27 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... Southwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 328 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Weymouth, or 11 miles east of Vineland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Barnegat, Hammonton, Absecon, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Surf City, Port Republic, Elwood-Magnolia, Wading River, Dorothy, Warren Grove, Chatsworth, Wharton State Forest, Pomona, Mays Landing, Brookville, Bass River State Forest and Batsto. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 39 and 67. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 9 and 25. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
